children.name: deserve
children.definition: if you think that sb deserves something bad that happens to them, you think it is fair that it happens because they have done something wrong or stupid: đáng
examples: deserve to do something
▪ Anyone who drives like that deserves to lose their licence.
deserve itdeserve the bad things that happen : đáng đời
▪ ‘You really weren’t very nice to her.’ ‘Well, she deserved it!’
get what you deserve[verb phrase] especially spoken use this when you think sb deserves a punishment or bad experience, because it is a result of their own actions:
▪ ‘Do you feel sorry for him?’ ‘No, he shouldn’t have hit that guy -- he got what he deserved.’
▪ He was a bully, and in the end he got what he deserved.

children.name: serve sb right
children.definition: use this to say you think sb deserves sth bad that happens to them because they have beenunkindor done sthstupid: đáng đời ai
examples: serve sb right for
▪ ‘I feel terrible.’ ‘Serves you right for drinking so much last night.’
it serves sb right
▪ It’d serve him right if Jo walked out on him.

children.name: be asking for it
children.definition: say this when something bad happens to someone and you think they deserve it because their behaviour made it very likely to happen: tự chuốc lấy
examples: ▪ Anyone who invites a complete stranger into their house is asking for it.

children.name: had it coming
children.definition: use this to say you think someone deserves something bad that happens to them, and this is what you expected to happen: tự chuốc lấy
examples: ▪ I don’t feel sorry for her at all. She had it coming.
had it coming to you/her etc
▪ ‘Terry’s very upset about his wife leaving him.’ ‘Well he’s had it coming to him for years.’

children.name: comeuppance
children.definition: get your  to finally get the punishment or something bad that you deserve because of the way you have behaved: “quở trách, trừng phạt”
examples: ▪ The evil Mr Grove gets his comeuppance at the end of the story.
▪ She’s callous and snobbish and it’s time she got her comeuppance.

children.name: get your just deserts
children.definition: to finally get the punishment you deserve, especially after having avoided it for a long time: nhận trừng trị, nhận trừng phạt
examples: ▪ Tobin finally got his just deserts, and was sentenced to 8 years’ imprisonment.
▪ This is a movie in which everyone gets their just deserts in the end.

children.name: deserve
children.definition: if you deserve sth, it is right that you should have it, because you have worked hard, done something well etc: xứng đáng với
examples: ▪ Well done. I think we all deserve a drink after that.
▪ Jill was awarded first prize, and she thoroughly deserved it.
▪ After all that hard work, you deserve a rest.

children.name: deserve to do sth
examples: ▪ The team have trained hard and they deserve to do well.
▪ Chang played better than Sampras, and he deserved to win.

children.name: deserve a medalused humorously about someone who has worked very hard or done something very difficult
examples: ▪ Anyone who can work with that man deserves a medal.

children.name: well-deserved
children.definition: /well-earned a well-deserved or well-earned rest, win, drink etc is one that you deserve to have, because you have worked hard: xứng đáng
examples: ▪ The game ended in a well-deserved victory for the German team.
▪ At 9 o'clock, she settled down for a well-earned rest.

children.name: have earned
children.definition: to deserve sth such as reward, success, or sb’s respect etc because you have worked very hard or done sth impressive: xứng đáng
examples: ▪ I think Paul should get first prize - he’s certainly earned it.
▪ Let’s have a break now - we’ve definitely earned it.

children.name: to deserve an answer, explanation, apology etc
deserve
children.definition: alsobe oweddeserve/be owed an explanation/apology/answeruse this to say that sb should have an explanation etc, especially from sb who does not want to explain or apologize: xứng, đáng
examples: She feels she deserves an apology after all the cruel things you said about her.
Why didn’t you turn up for the meeting? I think I’m at least owed some kind of explanation.
Why did ministers fail to inform the public of these dangers? The people of Britain deserve answers.

children.name: deserve
children.definition: /merit  if a suggestion, idea, or plan deserves consideration, attention etc, it is good enough to be considered or examined in more detail: đáng, xứng
examples: Neal’s book explores some interesting ideas which deserve attention.
This is a complex problem, that deserves closer consideration.

children.name: merit
children.definition: if a suggestion, idea, or plan merits consideration, attention etc, it is good enough to be considered or examined in more detail: đáng, xứng
examples: The results have been encouraging enough to merit further investigation.
It’s a fascinating book which merits attention.
It’s an interesting idea and it certainly merits another look.
merit[U]C1formala good quality that makes sb/sth deserve praise :
There isnever anymerit inbeing second best.
have (some) merit/be of merit(= be good )
The suggestion has some merit.
on merit
Students are selected solely on merit(= because they are good ).
artistic/literary merit
a film lacking any artistic merit
